page.title: 16R.A.F. WADDINGTON
page.content:
Until last year R.A.F Waddington was a station for Vulcan bombers. At present they are beginning trials for the AWACs (early-warning radar aircraft). Because of
problems, however, the whole future of the new system and of Waddington is in doubt. So, for now, there are only two Vulcans and one Nimrod stationed at Waddington. This has meant a big drop in the number of servicemen. On the camp there is a junior ranks club, a corporals club, a sergeants mess and an officers mess. There are two churches, an education centre with library, a nursery, a theatre, a sports hall, sports field and a swimming pool. There are fire, repair and engineering shops and briefing and flight planning and control rooms.
